answers.answer: HiWelcome to the MedHelp forum!Since you have burning in the armpit groin it is possible due to heat intolerance (hyperthyroidism) and due to sweat dermatitis.It is also possible due to peripheral artery disease. Peripheral neuropathies as in diabetes, chemical burns due to any deo or lotions you use, peripheral nerve compression (possible as you have tingling and numbness) are the other possibilities. Please get yourself investigated in these lines. Hope this helps. Please let me know if there is any thing else and do keep me posted. Take care!

question: Started mid-December 2009 with burning sensation under the armpit areas.  Two months later and several tests and evaluations later all negative.  Developed muscle twitching in my left thumb pad area and now there is numbness and tinglinging in my feet and left leg.  What's going on?  Help.  I am still in my 30's.This discussion is related to/posts/show/202357.
